ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Institute of Science and Technology Austria

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Institute of Science and Technology Austria

SHORT_DESCR.P: 1 closed-cycle dilution refrigerator was required by a research group at IST Austria conducting long term experiments which can last for a number of months or years.
1 closed-cycle dilution refrigerator was required by a research group at IST Austria conducting long term experiments which can last for a number of months or years.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: In the Quantum Integrated Devices Laboratory, superconducting, photonic and micromechanical integrated circuits are cooled to their quantum mechanical ground state. The goal is to observe and verify unique quantum effects in solid state based microchips. Subsequently these effects will be put to work to demonstrate quantum communication and quantum information processing with individual electromagnetic and mechanical excitations. One specific experiment will involve the electro‐optic coupling of individual microwave photons synthesized by a superconducting quantum bit (qubit) to single telecom band wavelength photons for the purpose of establishing long distance quantum communication between solid state quantum processors.
The scientific research activities as mentioned above represent the following minimal technical requirements for the system:
A. Base temperature: maximum 10 mK (including required low ohmic DC wiring)
B. Cooling power: at least 14 μW at 20 mK
C. Guaranteed long uninterrupted cooling time: at least 2 years of cooling without service and resilient to liquid nitrogen shortage
D. Guaranteed low vibration option: proven option to pause the pulse tube for an extended amount of time
E. Experimental space: at least a length of 300 mm at base temperature including radiation and magnetic shielding
The investigation shows clearly that only the Bluefors Oy fridge LD250 fulfills all required minimum technical specifications presented by all planned experiments.

With several suppliers on the market only one product distributed by one company meets the technical minimum requirements which necessitate the planned test configurations provided by IST Austria: LD250 by Bluefors Oy. The system can only be purchased from Bluefors OY and not via other suppliers. Therefore, procurement is to be made by way of a negotiated procedure with a single tenderer without prior notice pursuant to § 36 para1 no3 Bundesvergabegesetz 2006 i.d.g.F. [Austrian Federal Law on Public Procurement]. The apparatuses are to be purchased by Oxford Instruments.
